summary: This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons chain of custody log for evidence recovered from Jeffrey Epstein's cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 12, 2019. It details the seizure of personal items, medications, and correspondence, and records their transfer to the Special Investigative Services (SIS) Office.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffery
persons.context: The suspect from whose cell (9 South 206-220-LAD) the evidence items were recovered. Listed with prisoner number 76318-054.

events.title: Evidence Recovery from Epstein's Cell
events.description: Bureau of Prisons personnel recovered multiple items of evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: Evidence Transfer to SIS Office
events.description: The recovered evidence was released and transferred to the Special Investigative Services (SIS) Office at 1:10 PM.

locations: 9 South 206-220-LAD (Epstein's cell location at MCC, New York)
SIS Office (Special Investigative Services Office at the prison)
keyFacts: Evidence was recovered from Jeffrey Epstein's prison cell on August 12, 2019, the day after his death.
Recovered items included medications (pain relief, methylprednisolone, milk of magnesia), personal effects (glasses, bible, headphones), and correspondence (letter mail, envelope).
One item was described as a 'brown paper bag with writing "SW U2 dinner"', potentially indicating planned social activities or contacts.
All evidence was marked 'Hold as evidence' and transferred to the prison's Special Investigative Services (SIS) Office for analysis.
The document is a formal chain of custody log, establishing the legal handling of evidence post-mortem.
